text:
Champions League
Valencia - Lille: which team for Galtier?
The Dogues have nothing to lose at C1 and for this fourth game, Christophe Galtier should play for everything.
05 Nov 2019, 09:20 by Thomas Rassouli



Renato SanchesClub previous: Bayern MunichCompensation: 20 millionIcon Sport



Tiago DjaloClub previous: Milan ACIndemnity: NCIcon Sport



Yusuf YaciziClub previous: TrabzonsporIndemnity: 16.5 millionIcon Sport



Domagoj BradaricClub previous: Hajduk SplitIndemnity: 6.5 millionIcon Sport



Victor Osimhen Previous club: Sporting CharleroiIndemnity: 12 millionIcon Sport



ReinildoClub previous: BelenensesCompensation: 3 millionIcon Sport



Tomothy WeahClub previous: PSGIndemnity: 10 millionIcon Sport



Previous Leonardo Club: Rio AveCompensation: 6 millionIcon Sport



Benjamin Andr√©Club previous: Stade RennaisIndemnity: 8 millionIcon Sport



Virgiliu PostolachiClub previous: PSGIndemnity: freeIcon Sport

Lille: all the rookies of the 2019 transfer window




Lille is still looking for its first win in the Champions League this season. With a draw for two consecutive defeats, the Lille are in the last place of their group, and therefore have little hope of reaching the next stage of the competition. In Valencia on Tuesday, victory is essential to believe it again.




Towards a 5-3-2




The probable composition of the LOSC + 10 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

For this trip, Lille should evolve in a solid 5-3-2. Maignan should therefore be protected by a Soumaoro-Fonte-Gabriel hinge, assisted by Celik and Reinildo on the sides. In the middle, the duo Andr√©-Soumar√© would be accompanied by Yacizi, more to the creation. In front, Osimhen and Ikon√© would be responsible for bringing the danger.
